section1.title: Order Management System (Omni)

sketch.subText: Sketch 1: User Flow Diagram (most used features)
Sketch2: Prepare Shipments Sketch (previous vs new) with notes
Sketch2: Pack Shipments Sketch (previous vs new) with notes

section1.problem: While working retail, many of my coworkers and I have been using a system that is not user-friendly, faces bugs and is not very intuitive at times. Working there as a Fulfilment Associate for the most time, I was able to identify several problems regarding shelf locations, order fulfilment workflow and the overall user experience.
section1.solution: With this design, I chose to tackle the most common problems of not being able to find certain items, displaying more information regarding the orders to ensure quality service and efficiency for my fellow associates.

section2.summary: This page consists of my progress of the Order Management System that I am building a prototype for. It is solely based on the system I use at my retail job BuyBuyBaby to use to fulfill orders for customers.
section2.designRemarks: I have used BuyBuyBaby colors as opposed to the dark color scheme used in our Omni Application.
lessonsLearned: Figma is so much better than Adobe XD and I would want to use it again.
Hunting for icons is fun but also being able to use appropiate icons for the context is very important.
Understanding that in retail, employees shouldn't be learning new technologies at all times due to priorities so I have to make sure that the new design is always easy to learn and adapt to.
section2.nextSteps: In progress prototype will require more time and effort to fully complete, but I am taking a break from this for now to prioritize other projects. (BuyBuyBaby is closing everywhere and I am losing my job and eventually the motivation behind building this but I do intend on going back to it once I have completed my other projects.)
